member.name: ID2D1EffectImpl.Initialize
member.summary: The effect can use this method to do one time initialization tasks. If this method is not needed, the method can just return S_OK.
member.param: An internal context interface that creates and returns effect author–centric types.
The effect can populate the transform graph with a topology and can update it later.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ID2D1EffectImpl.PrepareForRender
member.summary: Prepares an effect for the rendering process.
member.param: Indicates the type of change the effect should expect.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ID2D1EffectImpl.SetGraph

summary.para: The renderer calls this method to provide the effect implementation with a way to specify its transform graph and transform graph changes.
The renderer calls this method when:

item.description: When the effect is first initialized.
If the number of inputs to the effect changes.

member.param: The graph to which the effect describes its transform topology through the SetDescription call.

returns.para: An error that prevents the effect from being initialized if called as part of the CreateEffect call. If the effect fails a subsequent SetGraph call:

item.description: The error will be returned from the property method that caused the number of inputs to the effect to change.

The effect object will be placed into an error state, if subsequently used to render, the context will be placed into a temporary error state, that particular effect will fail to render and the failure will be returned on the next EndDraw or Flush call.

member.name: ID2D1EffectImpl
